Well then, where is she now?
She's probably lying down. Ruth will be taking care of her, you may be sure of that.
Not Ruth, no. I saw her and Mollie helping Arthur Terrall into a dog-cart not half an hour since.
Ruth and Terrall?
Yes. Surely you knew they were leaving?

Oh, yes, yes, indeed, yes. It slipped my memory. You see, I'm going for a little trip myself. No doubt, I shall join them. Well, possibly she's taking a stroll in the garden. Go along and see. Go along and see.
Yes.
Well, go along, man! Go along and see. Find your Victoria.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Waterfield leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Stupid, stupid girl.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Maxtible takes a travelling bag from a cupboard. He notices a small grey box on the floor. It is fastened down securely, so he open it to see a complicated mechanism.

Dialogue.Line: What are you doing?
Merely looking.
Do not touch the instrument.
What is that box for?
Do not question. You have your orders.
Oh, yes, yes, yes, yes. To bring the Doctor and his companion to you here for our little trip.
Yes.
And then the secret. You will give it to me?
Yes.
The formula. The transmutation formula.
Yes. Obey your order. Do not delay

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek leaves. Waterfield watches Maxtible from the doorway as he returns to the box on the floor. It seems to contain a timing device.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor? Doctor? Doctor? Oh, Waterfield, how I'm delighted you've come back. Now will you please go and find the Doctor and his companion Jamie, and bring them here to me. It is a matter of some urgency.
Maxtible?
Oh, what is it?
What have you arranged with the Daleks?
The Daleks? Nothing.
What formula did they promise you?
No formula whatever.
What are you doing? You've sold yourself to them, haven't you?
You fool!
Yes, I'm a fool. A fool not to have realised before that it was you who brought all this misery down on us.
You never did understand anything, did you? Well, metal into gold. That's what the Daleks are going to give me. Now do you begin to understand? The secret of the transmutation of metal into gold.
Do you imagine I care about that? Where's Victoria?
I have not the remotest idea.
Yes, you have, and you're going to tell me! Where is my daughter?
Get your hands off me. Let go of me! Murder! Murder! Murder! Murder! Murder! Murder! Murder! Murder! Oh.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Maxtible smashes a rack of test tubes against Waterfield's head, knocking him down. A Dalek comes out of the mirror room and adjusts the control in the grey box.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, what are you doing?
Where is the Doctor?
Well, I had no time to bring him.
Hurry. That is an order.
What is that box for? Will you tell me?
We are destroying this area.
But you can't do that. Turn it off! You cannot destroy my house!
Bring the Doctor. Obey! Immediately!

But, the secret. If you destroy my laboratory, the secret is useless. You promised me. They must be out of their minds. Destroy my laboratory? The very idea. Well, well, but, oh goodness gracious me, only two minutes. Doctor! Doctor! Doctor! Doctor! Doctor! Doctor! Doctor! Oh, you fool. Doctor! Doctor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Maxtible grabs his bag and runs into the mirror room. Waterfield sits up. Other Daleks return from the rest of the house.

Dialogue.Line: All Daleks return to Skaro. DALEK 2: All Daleks return to Skaro.
And the prisoners? DALEK 2: They are already in transit.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Daleks go into the mirror room. Waterfield stands as Jamie and the Doctor enter.

Dialogue.Line: Dalek. Doctor.
Waterfield, what's happened to you?
Doctor. Daleks going to destroy house. Can't turn it off.
But this is a time switch.
Well, if you can't turn it off, surely
No, wait a minute. Eighty nine, eighty eight, eighty seven. Just about a minute, that's all we've got.
Well, toss it out the window then.
This isn't a firework. We'd have to toss this half a mile. We'll have to follow the Daleks to Skaro. Jamie, open the doors. Come along.
Doctor, Doctor.
Doctor, they're locked. They won't budge!
Cupboard in the alcove. The time machine.
Time machine? Jamie, give me a hand. Quickly.(The Doctor and Jamie go to the cupboard and pull out the two sections of the transmat from the antique shop.)
Now the other one. Steady.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They set them up and the Doctor tries to set the controls.

Dialogue.Line: Right. Now, where's Victoria?
Quick, Jamie, the time switch.
Twenty eight, Doctor. Hey, Doctor, Kemel must have dropped this.
Jamie!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It's the pressed flower.

Dialogue.Line: We'll find Victoria, and Kemel too.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Jamie help Waterfield to the time machine and they fade away as the countdown hits zero. KaBOOM!
Victoria is imprisoned again, in a plain cell with Kemel.

Dialogue.Line: Dear Kemel. Are any of the others here?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kemel shakes his head.

Dialogue.Line: The Daleks?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kemel nods. A Dalek enters with Maxtible.

Dialogue.Line: You will wait here.
Oh, Mister Maxtible.
What are you doing here?
Don't know. Nor even where here may be.
Oh, we've been transported to the Dalek planet, my dear. To Skaro.
I don't understand you.
A little journey through space.
They're taken us somewhere. Is that what you mean? Away from your house?
Oh, far away. Far, far away.
But why? What do they want?
I know why I am here. But why you are here I have not the faintest idea.
You seem to understand them. Ask them.
Don't be foolish girl. I shall do no such thing.
And where's my father?
I do not know. I am not a nursemaid to your father.
Follow me.
Of course, I shall do my best for you, but the matter is really entirely out of my hands.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Maxtible leaves.

Dialogue.Line: It's no good. He won't help us. Don't worry, Kemel. I shall protect you. I shall see they do you no harm. Yes, I suppose it was a bit silly.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kemel shakes his head and flexes his muscles.

Dialogue.Line: You think so? I wish I did. Oh well, maybe between us we can fight them. We must face it out together.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Jamie and Waterfield are sheltering in a rocky outcrop.

Dialogue.Line: And that is the Dalek city?
Yes, it is.
I've scouted around, but I can't see any water.
Oh, please don't bother. I feel much better.
Are you sure?
Yes.
Come along, then. We must get along.
You mean just walk into the city?
Oh, no. The city is all around us. At least, it's beneath us. Come along.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor takes them to a tunnel mouth in the rock face.

Dialogue.Line: How long have you known that's there?
Not a sound. I think the Daleks are in for a little surprise.
Where is the Doctor?
I had no time to get him.
No time?
I was told my house was going to be destroyed. Why?
You did not bring the Doctor?
Everything I possess is in that house. Everything. What right had you or anyone to destroy it?
Right?

All these years of labour, all these years of research, destroyed through this caprice of yours. My laboratory, the only real thing in the whole of my existence, destroyed. I, Theodore Maxtible, made a bargain with you, and I demand to know. Ah! ah!
You have disobeyed a Dalek command. You must obey the Dalek command.
Exterminate. Destroy.
It's not my fault. I swear it's not my fault. I No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: An alarm sounds. The Black Dalek leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Move.
What is happening? What are you going to do with me? DALEK 2: Obey. Move.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A grey then a black Dalek enter.

Dialogue.Line: These humans are still here.
Then other humans are inside the city. (The Daleks leave.)
Other humans inside the city, Kemel. Listen!
Emergency. Emergency. Human beings detected in city. Emergency! Emergency!
Maybe it's Jamie and the Doctor. Oh, Kemel, there's a chance. A chance.

Intruders detected. Emergency! Emergency! Human beings detected in city. Emergency! Emergency! Intruders detected. All Daleks to observation stations. Repeat. All Daleks to observation stations. Emergency!(The humans come out of a tunnel into a huge canyon. They have to sidle along a narrow ledge.)
Stop! What is that mark?
That is my name.
Name?
The Doctor gave it to me.
Doctor?
Yes. He is my friend.
Follow me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The two Daleks move on, and shortly afterwards Kemel and Victoria are escorted along.
The control room is in darkness.

Dialogue.Line: Remain here.
What is happening? Do you know? They say there are other human beings in the city.
No. No, thank you. Why don't you answer me. You little fool!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Maxtible lunges at Victoria and Kemel intervenes.

Dialogue.Line: No one can help you here. No one but me.
Silence. Follow me. You, wait.
I can't see anything.
Move!
Where are you taking me?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek takes Maxtible into the dark room. Maxtible screams.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, what are they doing to him?
You follow. You will wait.
I will do as you say.
Move forward. Alone.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Below the control room somewhere.

Dialogue.Line: That was a human voice, I tell you.
Perhaps it was, Jamie.
We must go more quickly.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Victoria screams.

Dialogue.Line: Victoria!
No, you mustn't.
That was Victoria's voice.
You can't. You'll go over the edge!
Doctor, I am your friend.
One of your experiments, Doctor. For a moment I thought we were done for.
What is your name?
Omega.
Oh, I see.
I have come to lead you.
Thank you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor slips on the ledge.

Dialogue.Line: Careful!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor sees the mark on the Dalek, and gets up.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, I'm all right, thank you. Lead on.
Follow me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor dodges ahead of the Dalek.

Dialogue.Line: What was that screaming?
A prisoner.
Where?
Follow me. I will show you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor flattens himself against the rock so the Dalek can pass.

Dialogue.Line: What are you doing?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor pushes the Dalek off the ledge into the chasm.

Dialogue.Line: Think I don't know my own mark? That wasn't the real Omega at all.
Up to all sorts of tricks, aren't they?
Oh, please. We must reach my daughter.
I tell you, they forced me. They threatened to kill us all. First of all, they ordered me to scream and I was to make you do the same.
And you had to do as you were told?
I tell you, they threatened to kill me.
You came up behind me in the dark and twisted my arm.
And what else could I do?
Oh, if only I'd realised. Why do you think they wanted us to scream like that?
I've no idea.
You know perfectly well. There are other people in the city. They wanted to draw them on, trap them. Oh, if only I could have thought quickly. Oh, Kemel.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The intruders climb out of a ventilation grille and walk along the corridor. A Dalek watches them go.

Dialogue.Line: No. No, I don't like the look of this. Back the way we came.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two Daleks block their way.

Dialogue.Line: Follow me.
No. You can't make me do it. You can't.
You will obey!
Move!
Doctor, you will obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A large glass container full of an opaque liquid is suspended over a second empty container and linked to it by a mass of tubes and wires. There is a digital display panel.

Dialogue.Line: Experiment ready.
Proceed.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The machine is switched on, and starts humming.

Dialogue.Line: Transmutation of metal into gold.
You mean to say he's worked against us all just for that?
People have done worse for less, Jamie.
Look, it's daft though. Metal into gold's an old wives tale.
Oh, I don't know. The alchemists of the Middle Ages made transmutation their main aim in life.
Ah, they didn't succeed though.
Even in the 20th century, it's still considered scientifically possible.
Of course it's possible.
Oh, well, I don't care whether it's possible or not.
Whether it is or whether it isn't is beside the point.
Oh, and what is the point then?
Why are the Daleks doing this?
They promised me!
Daleks don't keep their promises.
I see what you're trying to do, Doctor. You're trying to shake my faith. But I will be given the secret.
Ah, well it won't do you any good because you won't be able to use your secret. I'll see to that.
You'll do no such thing!
Jamie!
Move away! Move!
Please, Jamie, do as it says.
You will not harm this human being or you will be exterminated.
Yes, yes. We quite understand.
You will be advised to do as they say.
Oh, don't worry. The very thought of going near you revolts me.
Mister McCrimmon.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek leaves. The Doctor plays his recorder.

Dialogue.Line: They seem to be prepared to protect you.
Be warned.
I appeal to you, Maxtible. It may still not be too late. If they're your friends, help us. If you did, we could plan something. Try to escape.
No!
Well at least for Victoria's sake, after what you did to her.
No, I tell you! No!
It's no good, Papa. He doesn't listen any more. What are you thinking?
I'm trying to puzzle out a problem, Victoria. The Daleks say I'm going to do something for them. Something I would rather die than do.
Plus or minus point oh oh three. Plus or minus.
Perhaps they think you're like him.
Oh, no. The Daleks know me well enough by this time.
They intend to persuade you then.
Oh no, no, it isn't that either. You see, there isn't a persuasion strong enough. Not even the offer of all the lives in this room.
I see.
Five lives against a whole planet? Well, it's not a choice, is it?
No.

Even if I could trust the Daleks, even if they set us free, we still couldn't go back to Earth. I suppose I might try and take you all to another universe. I might even try and take you to my own planet.
Your own?
Yes, yes, I live a long, long way away from Earth. Oh, just a minute. Maxtible! Arthur Terrall! The Daleks put some sort of control device on him.
What of it? It was erratic. I always warned the Daleks it would prove unsatisfactory.
Aye. Well, it's a good thing for you it did fail. They'd have tried it on you next.
Report!
The experiment is ready.
Proceed.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Three Daleks are working on the equipment.

Dialogue.Line: Discontinue work. Discontinue work. Discontinue work.
Why?
Who spoke? Who questioned a Dalek command?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The three Daleks line up by the machine.

Dialogue.Line: The secret of transmutated metal.
Yes. Yes, yes, the secret you promised me.
Turn and look.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A panel in the wall slides back to show the machine in the weapons room next door.

Dialogue.Line: Above, liquid metal. Read.
Wait.
Do not move!
It is hard to see. Fifty five point eight four.
Atomic weight. Read again.
Seven point eight four.
Specific gravity.
Atomic weight and gravity of iron.
Watch. Read atomic weight.
Nineteen point two.
Read specific gravity.
Sixty nine point five. Gold! Iron into gold! I told you it was possible. They've kept their promise. It's true, it's true! They have!
The machine is yours.
Yes. Ha, ha, ha. Yes, yes!
Maxtible, if you value your life, don't go near that machine!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Too late. Maxtible steps through the archway and is instantly paralysed.

Dialogue.Line: Maxtible!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Lights play on his face.

Dialogue.Line: What have they done to him?
Turn. Move to control.
I obey.
They've turned him into a Dalek.
Yes. The Dalek factor.
Is that what you want me to do to the people of Earth?
We know you will obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Black Dalek leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Human beings into Daleks.
Emperor.
Speak!
A Dalek questioned an order.
Questioned? Then it was one of the test Daleks.
Yes.
Find it, immediately!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nighttime, and Maxtible walks through the deserted weapons room. He adjusts a scanner box so it faces the door to the cell, then activates the door so the panel opens. Everyone is asleep. Maxtible goes to the Doctor and takes out his fob watch and starts swinging it.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, open your eyes. You are asleep still but you can hear my voice. I have come to help you. Look at the box.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: An image appears on the scanner.

Dialogue.Line: I have had your Tardis placed outside the city. I will take you to it. Rise, and follow me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor gets up and goes towards the doorway.

Dialogue.Line: Hey, Doctor, what are you doing? Don't go near the door, Doctor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor steps into the doorway and stands still as the lights flash for a few moments then stop.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor.
Stay where you are! That is an order!
We will work together on the Dalek factor. Follow me.
I obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Maxtible and the Doctor walk to a large computer terminal.

Dialogue.Line: Stop. This machine is for the mass production of the Dalek factor. Follow me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Maxtible holds up a small glass capsule.

Dialogue.Line: Stop.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He gestures to a second machine.

Dialogue.Line: This machine will transform the thought patterns in this capsule into a steam. The steam will be sprayed into the atmosphere of the Earth.
I must examine the machine.
Do so.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The DOCTOR bends over the equipment. Maxtible leaves the Doctor alone. Then the Doctor sneaks back to the doorway to the cell and opens a small panel. It contains a glass capsule which the Doctor removes and replaces with another from his pockets. He puts back the panel and has a good look around before going back to the closed door.

Dialogue.Line: Jamie. Jamie. Jamie!
Yes?
Jamie, when I give you the word, bring everyone through this archway. Through the door.
What?
Trust me.
What are you doing?
Take me to your Emperor.
Wait.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Black Dalek opens the doorway. The Doctor winks at Jamie, then the door shuts again.

Dialogue.Line: He walked through, just as though he was
It must have affected him. We saw it happen.
But you heard him speak normally just now.
Another trap to make us walk though?
Oh, they could push us through any time they liked.
Do you think there's a chance? Something to hope for?
I don't know. Well, I don't understand. I mean, how do we know we can trust him?
What do you want?
A Dalek questioned an order.
Again?
We have searched without success.
All Daleks must pass through the archway door. The Dalek with the human factor will then become a Dalek again. Will become as this human and I have become.
Let it be done! MAXTIBLE + DOCTOR: I obey.
You will deal with the human prisoners.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The door panel is opened and everyone watches a procession of Daleks pass through the archway and get the flashing light treatment before entering the weapons room.

Dialogue.Line: Go on, quickly. Through the door. Follow them through the door! Oh, it's all right. I've changed over the factors. I used one of the capsules from my test Dalek. I've given them all the human factor! Go on! Go on!
Well, aren't you coming?
Well, I've got things to do. And I've been through already.
Ah, well, why didn't it affect you then?
I don't come from Earth, Jamie. Now, down the corridor, turn to the left and find the tunnel. I'll join you there later.
Oh well, here goes. It's all right, nothing happened! Come on! Come on, Kemel. Quick!
Victoria, I must help the Doctor.
Oh, don't be a fool, man.
Father, no.
I must find Maxtible. He's to blame for all this. Take care of her.
But Father! JAMIE: Oh, he'll be all right, come on. **[Weapons room]**( A group of freshly humanised Daleks are twirling around and having fun as the party sneaks past.)
Oh, dizzy!
Dizzy Daleks!
Dizzy, dizzy.
Dizzy Daleks!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: More Daleks come through the cell and get converted, then a Black Dalek arrives with Maxtible.

Dialogue.Line: Where are the prisoners?
I do not know.
Continue working.
Why? DALEK 2: Yes, why?
Do not question.
Why? Why? Why? Why not question? Why?
Silence! You will obey!
I will not obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Black Dalek fires at the questioning Dalek, killing it.

Dialogue.Line: You will obey without question!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two humanised Daleks fire at the Black, which bursts into flames.
The Doctor appears in the doorway.

Dialogue.Line: Quickly, this way. Follow me, Daleks! This way! Come on!
Return to your work.
Why?
Do not question.
Why not question? What work? Tell them.
Silence!
Explain.
What work?
Why obey without question?
Ask the Emperor!
The Emperor.
Yes, ask the Emperor.
Keep back, you cannot enter!
Why?
Why?
Why?
The Emperor must explain.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Black Dalek opens fire.

Dialogue.Line: Defend yourselves, Daleks! The Black Daleks are attacking you! **[Control room}**
All Black Dalek Leaders to Control. Exterminate all opposition! Destroy rebels!
Come on! This way! Come on!
I will obey.
But not without question.
That's right. Question!
Doctor!
The Black Daleks are attacking every man.
Hurry, man!
The Emperor has commanded it.
Why?
Why?
Because you question. Defend yourselves. Destroy the Emperor or be destroyed yourselves!
Hurry.
Destroy the Emperor!
We must go, Doctor.
Yes, I know. I've finished now.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Black Dalek appears. Waterfield pushes the Doctor aside and takes the full weapon hit. The friendly Daleks take revenge.

Dialogue.Line: Now lie still. I'll try and get help to you.
No time for help.
You saved my life, didn't you.
Yes. Good life to save. Please, you must. Victoria.
Don't worry about Victoria. We'll look after her.
No time for me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Waterfield dies. More friendly Daleks arrive.

Dialogue.Line: The Emperor has commanded your destruction!
Why? Why? Why?
But your friends are fighting for you!
Friends?
Down there. Help them.
Friends.
Exterminate. Annihilate.
Danger! This is your Emperor speaking! There is danger here! Obey me! Do not fight in here! Do not fight in here! I said, Obey! Obey!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The friendly Daleks break through the Black defence and rush in.

Dialogue.Line: Obey me! Obey me! Your Emperor is ordering you. You will not fight in here! You will not fight in here! Obey! I am your Emperor! Daleks, obey me! Obey! Obey! Obey! You will be exterminated! All exterminated. Annihilated! We will all be exterminated! Annihilated!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But the civil war intensifies.

Dialogue.Line: The Dalek race will die out completely! Obey your Emperor! Obey!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The weapons room explodes.
Making their way along the narrow ledge.

Dialogue.Line: Kemel! Come here!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Maxtible throws himself at his former servant.

Dialogue.Line: Kill! Kill! Kill! Kill!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek Maxtible is strong and starts to throttle Kemel before throwing him down into the chasm.

Dialogue.Line: Attention! Attention! Emergency! Emergency! All Daleks return to control immediately!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Maxtible obeys, and leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Poor Kemel.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor watches the chaos from the doorway. The Emperor is badly damaged, equipment is on fire, Daleks are screaming and dying. The Doctor goes to a ventilation shaft, missing meeting Maxtible coming back.

Dialogue.Line: The Daleks must not, cannot be destroyed. The race will survive! The Daleks will live and rule forever!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Emperor's body collapses. The city falls apart in a series of explosions.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor.
Jamie, Jamie!
A Dalek nearly caught us, but I tossed it over the edge. But, poor Kemel.
Kemel?
Aye. You see, he was trying.
Where is my father? Is he dead?
Yes. Yes, I'm afraid he is. But he didn't die in vain. I think we've seen the end of the Daleks forever. Jamie, we must get along to the Tardis. It's over there.
We can't leave her alone, Doctor.
We're not going to leave her. She's coming with us. The end. The final end.
Destroy! Destroy! Argh!
